name: Riga Old Town
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Riga's Old Town is famous for its cobblestone streets, medieval architecture, and vibrant atmosphere. Visitors can explore charming cafes, shops, and historic landmarks.

name: Jūrmala Beach
description: Stretching along the Gulf of Riga, Jūrmala Beach is known for its soft white sands and scenic pine forests. It's a popular destination for relaxation, swimming, and enjoying water sports.

name: Gauja National Park
description: This stunning national park features deep valleys, sandstone cliffs, and the Gauja River. It's perfect for hiking, cycling, and exploring medieval castles like the Turaida Castle.

name: Rundāle Palace
description: Often referred to as the 'Versailles of Latvia', Rundāle Palace boasts exquisite Baroque architecture and beautifully landscaped gardens. Guided tours reveal its rich history and art.

name: Cēsis Castle
description: A medieval castle with a rich history, Cēsis Castle offers visitors a glimpse into Latvia's past. Its towers provide panoramic views of the surrounding area.

name: Kuldīga's Ventas Rumba
description: Home to Europe's widest waterfall, Ventas Rumba is a natural gem perfect for photography and enjoying nature. The charming town of Kuldīga nearby adds to the experience.

name: Aglona Basilica
description: A significant pilgrimage site, Aglona Basilica is known for its stunning Neoclassical architecture and serene atmosphere. It's a must-visit for those interested in spirituality and history.

name: Liepāja Beach
description: Liepāja Beach is famous for its unique white sand dunes and gentle waves, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing and swimming. The nearby city also boasts a rich musical heritage.

name: Turaida Museum Reserve
description: This open-air museum combines natural beauty with historical significance, featuring Turaida Castle and a variety of cultural exhibitions. It's a wonderful place to learn about Latvian heritage.

name: Salaspils Memorial Ensemble
description: A poignant memorial dedicated to the victims of the Salaspils concentration camp, this site offers a reflective space to learn about Latvia's history during WWII.

name: Koknese Castle Ruins
description: Overlooking the Daugava River, the ruins of Koknese Castle provide stunning views and a sense of history. The surrounding area is perfect for picnics and exploration.

name: Riga Central Market
description: One of the largest markets in Europe, Riga Central Market is housed in former zeppelin hangars. It's a vibrant place to sample local foods and shop for unique crafts.

name: Bauska Castle
description: This picturesque castle, located at the confluence of two rivers, offers beautiful views and is a great spot for history enthusiasts to learn about the region's past.

name: Vecrīga
description: The historic heart of Riga, Vecrīga is filled with colorful buildings, cafes, and shops. It's a lively hub for culture, history, and nightlife.

name: Daugavpils Fortress
description: One of the largest fortresses in Eastern Europe, Daugavpils Fortress is a fascinating monument of military architecture and offers engaging exhibitions and tours.

name: Jūrmala City Museum
description: This museum showcases the history and culture of Jūrmala, highlighting its development as a resort town. It's an insightful visit for those interested in local heritage.

name: Kandava Waterfall
description: A hidden gem, Kandava Waterfall is a beautiful spot for nature lovers. It’s one of the few waterfalls that flows over a dam, creating a picturesque scene.

name: Lielupe River
description: The Lielupe River is perfect for kayaking and boating, offering stunning views of the surrounding nature. It’s a great spot for outdoor adventures.

name: Talsi Lake
description: A beautiful lake surrounded by hills, Talsi Lake is ideal for swimming, fishing, and picnicking. The area is also home to scenic walking trails.

name: The Freedom Monument
description: A symbol of Latvian independence, the Freedom Monument stands proudly in the center of Riga. It commemorates those who fought for Latvia's freedom and is a must-see for visitors.

name: Dundaga Castle
description: This medieval castle offers a glimpse into Latvia's history and is surrounded by beautiful natural landscapes. Guided tours provide insights into its storied past.

name: Riga Art Nouveau District
description: Renowned for its stunning Art Nouveau architecture, this district is a treat for architecture enthusiasts. Many buildings feature intricate decorations and unique designs.

name: Cēsis
description: A charming medieval town with cobbled streets, Cēsis is known for its well-preserved castle and vibrant cultural scene, including festivals and art exhibitions.

name: Kuldīga Old Town
description: Famous for its wooden architecture, Kuldīga's Old Town is a picturesque area with quaint streets and unique shops. It's a hidden gem for those seeking authenticity.

name: Ventspils Beach
description: Known for its clean sands and family-friendly atmosphere, Ventspils Beach is ideal for swimming and sunbathing. The nearby promenade features cafes and recreational activities.

name: Lauku Sēta
description: A unique open-air museum showcasing traditional Latvian rural life. Visitors can engage in workshops, enjoy folk performances, and explore historical farmhouses.

name: The Great Ķemeri Bog
description: A stunning natural reserve, the Great Ķemeri Bog offers boardwalk trails through unique ecosystems. It’s a tranquil spot for birdwatching and enjoying nature.

name: Riga Motor Museum
description: This museum houses an impressive collection of vintage cars and motorcycles, showcasing automotive history in Latvia. It's a fun and educational experience for all ages.

name: Jelgava Palace
description: Once the summer residence of the Duke of Courland, Jelgava Palace features stunning architecture and beautiful gardens, making it a lovely spot for a leisurely stroll.

name: Baldone
description: This small town is famous for its mineral springs and wellness retreats. It’s a perfect destination for relaxation and rejuvenation amid nature.

name: Riga's Ethnographic Open-Air Museum
description: This expansive museum showcases traditional Latvian rural life through historical buildings and exhibits. It's an engaging place to learn about Latvia's heritage.

name: Koknese Park
description: This beautiful park surrounds the ruins of Koknese Castle and offers walking paths, picnic areas, and stunning views of the Daugava River.

name: Līgatne Nature Trails
description: These trails offer an immersive experience in Latvia's diverse flora and fauna. Visitors can spot wildlife while enjoying scenic walks in a tranquil environment.

name: Bauska Regional Museum
description: The museum showcases the history and culture of the Bauska region, featuring exhibitions on local traditions and artifacts. It's a fascinating stop for history buffs.

name: Riga Canal
description: A picturesque waterway that runs through the city, the Riga Canal is perfect for leisurely boat rides and scenic walks along its banks.

name: Cranberry Marsh
description: A unique natural site where visitors can explore cranberry harvesting during the season. It's a hidden gem for those interested in local produce and nature.

name: Pāvilosta
description: A quaint seaside town known for its laid-back atmosphere, Pāvilosta offers beautiful beaches and opportunities for water sports, such as kayaking and windsurfing.

name: Kuldīga's Rumba Waterfall
description: A hidden gem, this waterfall is the widest in Europe and provides a stunning natural backdrop for photography and nature walks.

name: The Museum of the Occupation of Latvia
description: This museum offers an insightful look into Latvia's history during the Soviet and Nazi occupations, providing a deep understanding of the nation's struggles.

name: Ventspils Castle
description: This well-preserved medieval castle now houses a museum showcasing the history of Ventspils. Its picturesque surroundings make it a lovely visit.

name: Jaunpils Castle
description: A romantic castle surrounded by picturesque landscapes, Jaunpils Castle offers guided tours and hosts various cultural events throughout the year.

name: Kuldīga Town Hall
description: An architectural highlight of Kuldīga, the Town Hall is a charming building that reflects the town's rich history and cultural significance.

name: The Latvian National Museum of Art
description: This museum houses an extensive collection of Latvian art from the 18th century to contemporary works. It's a must-visit for art lovers.

name: Grīziņkalns Park
description: A peaceful urban park in Riga, Grīziņkalns is an ideal spot for a leisurely walk or picnic, surrounded by greenery and natural beauty.

name: Skrunda-1
description: An abandoned Soviet-era military town, Skrunda-1 is a fascinating site for urban explorers. Guided tours reveal its intriguing history and architecture.

name: Cēsis Art Museum
description: Housed in a historic building, this museum features contemporary art exhibitions and cultural events, making it a vibrant part of the Cēsis cultural scene.

name: Nida
description: Located on the Curonian Spit, Nida is known for its stunning dunes and serene beaches. It's a perfect getaway for nature lovers and offers a tranquil atmosphere.

name: Pērkons, Daugava
description: An impressive monument dedicated to the Daugava River, this site features artistic representations and offers a beautiful view of the river and surrounding area.

name: Talsi
description: A charming town known for its beautiful lakes and hills, Talsi is perfect for outdoor activities and exploring local culture and history.
